intro: Cochlearia hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering stems. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Cochlearia hispanica is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
